{{Infobox Radio station |image =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Abclocalradio.png]] -->| |name = ABC Tropical North| |callsign = 4QAA| |coordinates = {{Coord|21|08|24.94|S|149|11|21.79|E|type:landmark_scale:2000_region:AU}} |airdate = 1951 | |frequency = 101.1 [[Megahertz|mHz]] [[frequency modulation|FM]] Mackay| |area = [[Mackay, Queensland|Mackay]]| |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | |website = [http://www.abc.net.au/tropic/ http://www.abc.net.au/tropic/] | }}
'''ABC Tropical North''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Mackay, Queensland|Mackay]] and broadcasting to the surrounding [[Regions of Queensland#Mackay|region]] in [[Queensland]]. This includes the towns of [[Proserpine, Queensland|Proserpine]], [[Sarina, Queensland|Sarina]], [[Bowen, Queensland|Bowen]] and the [[Whitsunday Islands]].
The station began broadcasting as '''4QA''' in 1951 on 756 AM, originally as a relay of the national program. Studios were then built and local programs began in 1955. The station now broadcasts through the following main [[FM Broadcasting|FM]] transmitters along with a number of low-power FM repeaters:
*'''4QAA''' 101.1 FM *'''4QAA/T''' 104.9 FM *'''4QAA/T''' 91.7 FM
==Local programs== ===Weekdays===
*Breakfast with Meecham Philpott â 5:30am to 8:00 am *Mornings with Kim Kleidon â 8:30 am to 11:00 am
===Saturday===
*Saturday Breakfast â 6:00 am to 10:00 am
ABC Tropical North produces and broadcasts Rural News & Information which is hosted by Miriam Hall as well as the Mornings program which is usually hosted by Aaron Stevens or Kim Kleidon and is broadcast throughout Queensland using the ABC Local Radio Queensland branding.
When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[ABC Capricornia]], [[ABC Southern Queensland]] and [[612 ABC Brisbane]].
